thread.title: Video: Bathurst champ in horrifying crash
thread.title_full: Video: Bathurst champ in horrifying crash

title: Video: Bathurst champ in horrifying crash
text:
Bathurst 1000: Chaz Mostert in shocking crash during qualifying Matthew Taylor FOX SPORTS Bathurst 1000: Chaz Mostert in shocking crash during qualifying Matthew Taylor FOX SPORTS Chaz Mostert's horror crash at Bathurst 1000 1:30 
V8 Supercars: Chaz Mostert has left the Bathurst 1000 track in an ambulance after a monster crash prematurely ended his qualifying race. October 9th 2015 26 minutes ago /video/video.news.com.au/Sport/Motor Sport/V8/ 
REIGNING Bathurst 1000 champion Chaz Mostert has broken his left leg and wrist in a horrific crash between the famous Mount Panorama Dipper and Forrest’s Elbow during qualifying for the Bathurst 1000. 
Mostert has been air-lifted to hispital in Orange and all track action has been suspended for the day while his Prodrive Racing Australia Ford Falcon is removed from the track and the flag marshal’s hut repaired. 
Mostert clipped a concrete wall with the front left of his car, sending the right hand side of his car into the opposite wall. 
The car then once again mounted the left hand wall, sliding along it at high speed and wiping the roof off a track marshals hut before landing on the road at Forrest’s Elbow. 
Mostert was taken away from the scene in an ambulance as the session was temporarily red flagged. 
The incident ripped doors, wheels and other panels off the #6 Falcon, with his participation in Sunday’s 1000km endurance classic now highly unlikely. Other Stories
